description: Commands to manage and view single addon conditions.

commands.name: az aks addon disable
commands.summary: Disable an enabled Kubernetes addon in a cluster.
examples: az aks addon disable -g myResourceGroup -n myAKSCluster -a monitoring

commands.name: az aks addon enable
commands.syntax:
az aks addon enable --addon
                    --name
                    --resource-group
                    [--ampls-resource-id]
                    [--appgw-id]
                    [--appgw-name]
                    [--appgw-subnet-cidr]
                    [--appgw-subnet-id]
                    [--appgw-watch-namespace]
                    [--data-collection-settings]
                    [--dns-zone-resource-ids]
                    [--enable-high-log-scale-mode {false, true}]
                    [--enable-msi-auth-for-monitoring {false, true}]
                    [--enable-secret-rotation]
                    [--enable-sgxquotehelper]
                    [--enable-syslog {false, true}]
                    [--no-wait]
                    [--rotation-poll-interval]
                    [--subnet-name]
                    [--workspace-resource-id]
examples: az aks addon enable --addon virtual-node --name MyManagedCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subnet-name VirtualNodeSubnet
az aks addon enable --name MyManagedCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup --addon ingress-appgw --appgw-subnet-cidr 10.2.0.0/16 --appgw-name gateway
az aks addon enable --name MyManagedCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup -a open-service-mesh

commands.name: az aks addon list
commands.summary: List status of all Kubernetes addons in given cluster.

commands.name: az aks addon show
commands.summary: Show status and configuration for an enabled Kubernetes addon in a given cluster.
examples: az aks addon show -g myResourceGroup -n myAKSCluster -a monitoring

commands.name: az aks addon update
commands.summary: Update an already enabled Kubernetes addon.
commands.syntax:
az aks addon update --addon
                    --name
                    --resource-group
                    [--ampls-resource-id]
                    [--appgw-id]
                    [--appgw-name]
                    [--appgw-subnet-cidr]
                    [--appgw-subnet-id]
                    [--appgw-watch-namespace]
                    [--data-collection-settings]
                    [--dns-zone-resource-ids]
                    [--enable-high-log-scale-mode {false, true}]
                    [--enable-msi-auth-for-monitoring {false, true}]
                    [--enable-secret-rotation]
                    [--enable-sgxquotehelper]
                    [--enable-syslog {false, true}]
                    [--no-wait]
                    [--rotation-poll-interval]
                    [--subnet-name]
                    [--workspace-resource-id]
examples: az aks addon update --addon virtual-node --name MyManagedCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subnet-name VirtualNodeSubnet
az aks addon update --name MyManagedCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup --addon ingress-appgw --appgw-subnet-cidr 10.2.0.0/16 --appgw-name gateway
